Dr. Andrzej P. Kądzielawa, Academic Activities

Conferences

Work in progress (oral presentations not included)...
  • 42nd International Conference of Theoretical Physics, Correlations DDD Coherence at Different Scales (Ustroń, Poland, September 2018) poster

    First-principle approach to correlated realistic molecular and atomic hydrogen planes: Role of the Heisenberg-type interaction and the superconductivity

  • International Conference on Strongly Correlated Electron Systems, SCES 2017 (Prague, Czechia, July 19, 2017) poster

    First-principle approach to correlated realistic molecular and atomic hydrogen planes: Role of the Heisenberg-type interaction and the superconductivity

  • International Conference on Strongly Correlated Electron Systems, SCES 2016 (Hangzhou, China, May 9, 2016) poster

    Rigorous analysis of many-electron effects in nanosystems: Quantum dot - ring nanostructure

  • Forum of understanding on Nanomaterials and their interdisciplinary applications, (Warszawa, Poland, June 2016) poster

    Rigorous analysis of many-electron effects in nanosystems: Quantum dot - ring nanostructure

  • Sympozjum obliczeniowych metod ab initio (Kraków, Poland, February 29, 2016) poster

    Efekty wieloelektronowe w nanoukładach: ścisłe wyniki dla nanostruktury kropka - pierścień

  • 20th International Conference on Magnetism (Barcelona, Spain, July 10, 2015) poster

    Correlation-induced transition in one-dimensional molecular hydrogen crystal

  • 4th Workshop on ab initio phonon calculations (Kraków, Poland, December 5, 2014) poster

    Electron-phonon interactions in selected correlated hydrogen systemswithin the Exact Diagonalization ab initio approach

  • 50th Karpacz School of Theoretical Physics (Karpacz, Poland, March 7, 2014) poster

    molecule as a two-site system with the ab initio optimization of single-particle wave functions in the correlated state revisited: Electron-proton coupling

  • the Autumn School on Correlated Electrons (Jülich, Germany, September 23, 2013) poster

    Metallization of atomic solid hydrogen within the extended Hubbard model

  • MCC2012 Summer Workshop (Urbana, Illinois, USA, July 2012) poster

    Effect of applied magnetic field on the Mott transition: Gutzwiller ansatz with adjustment of the orbital size
